problem.markdown:
>>You can use VLOOKUP to combine data into one range. What are the challenges of creating pivot tables based on this range? (Select all that apply)<<
[x] VLOOKUP needs to be recalculated when a change is made to a particular row in the table array, which can be very slow. [ ] VLOOKUP cannot bring data from a worksheet that is not in the same workbook. [ ] VLOOKUP must return an exact match to the lookup value. [x] VLOOKUP limits the number of rows to the maximum number of rows that Excel can handle.
[explanation] VLOOKUP recalculation can be very slow. In addition, to use VLOOKUP you are bound by the maximum number of rows that Excel can have in one sheet. [explanation]
